name: HOTEL OPERA

reviews.text: Very happy with our stay at this hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Good location very close to metro station and Palace Real. Also buses and scenic bus route stop very close to hotel. Would definitely choose this hotel again as we didn't see any location we liked better when walking around the city. Cafe at hotel was also good and reasonably priced (by Madrid standards).
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an ideal stay in central Madrid based at the Hotel Opera however a rather bizarre & in all honesty unsettling incident did spoil one of our 4 nights (more of that later) but overall this is a great place to stay in which to explore a truly great city.
reviews.title: Curious Case of the Exploding Glass Door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife had previously stayed in Madrid so we were knew what to look for & how much to pay when booking a hotel & we quickly settled on the Hotel Opera due to location, price & the fact that it looked relatively modern. We were genereally accurate with what we expected & were glad we ended up choosing the Opera.
reviews.title: located very well!

reviews.text: Having explored almost the entire city over 5 days, we really wouldn't have picked a different location. Within minutes of checking-in we strolled perhaps 200 yards to a perfect bar on the Plaza De Oriente overlooking the wonderful Royal Palace watching the sunset. Back in the room to shower, etc & within the same distance in the opposite direction we were at the end of a perfect pedestrianised shopping street full of good quality stores & bars, restaurants, etc that ended at Puerto del Sol. Even before we quite knew our way around the city it was clear we truly had a fantastic location to base ourselves at.
reviews.title: No no...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is compact & therefore the lobby is very small with only an adjoining cafe, bar & breakfast room to effectively serve as public areas. There's certainly not a great deal of spacious public areas in which to retire with a drink but this isn't a problem as within steps from the hotel you're surounded by al manner of bars, restaurants, etc. The metro stop can be seen from the entrance of the hotel & the metro station from which we caught direct trains to the Zoo & Bernabau were perhaps a 10 minute walk away.
reviews.title: simply excellent!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Opera between 2nd - 5th April and thoroughly enjoyed both the hotel and Madrid in general. We booked a top floor room with jacuzzi and this was really good. Although the rooms are not big, they are very clean and are as they are advertised. The hotel itself is quite small and in a quiet location 2 mins from the Palace. Breakfast was fine, not amazing, but again clean, efficient and friendly. Daniel and Riccardo on the front desk were very friendly and helpful, offering advice about Madrid. We would definitely return to Madrid and the Hotel Opera!
reviews.title: Perfect location, friendly service at Hotel Opera

reviews.text: the stuff was mean and helpless. i've booked a room with transfer to the airport included to the price. The day of my departure I asked the guy at the reception what time should i leave the hotel if I have to be at the airport at 8.30. "7.45 is enough" he said. The car was there almost 8. And then, suddenly they told me we will go and pick up other passengers from the other hotels. i called there from the car and asked them what should i do? they told me there was nothing they could do.
reviews.title: horrible stuff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i am sure, they could find another cars for those other passengers, cause it was not myfalut that the car came to late and, most of all, that they didn't warn me about those other passengers. The manager i talked to, was incredibly helpless and mean, and during this phone call she didnt even try to listen to me, she said it wasn't their fault because of traffic, but i don't understand why it has to be MY problem, if transfer is included to the price. in the end of our talk she just hang up the phone!!! i couldnt believe it.
reviews.title: Vacation stay in Hotel Opera-Madrid

reviews.title: Excellent Easter Weekend

reviews.text: which actually was horrible - cause i have business meetings early in the morning next day.
reviews.title: Convenience

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Opera with my husband and son on June 2011. Very spacious room, loved the wooden floor and the bathroom was amazing. Two windows with great views to the Plaza and Theater, the Metro stop is across the street and so is a bus stop, restaurant on the first floor. Great breakfast with a huge variety. Loved the french bread with serrano ham and the Churros. The location was great, very close to The Palace also and main attractions. Lots of restaurants and places to eat. Recommend Los 100 Montaditos. I will recommend this hotel to everybody and will stay there at my next visit.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel. Great location, close enough to the centre but in a tranquil part of town.
reviews.title: Excellent for a weekend break

reviews.text: Room: we were in 409. Very comfortable room, pillows were soft, but we managed. No bath, but that wasn't a problem great shower though. Bit of street noise, but its Madrid. Staff were lovely and very helpful. Breakfast was what was expected, standard hotel fare. The attached cafe/bar was really nice too for a drink or a coffee. Just what you need for a weekend away.
reviews.title: Hotel Opera Clean and Convenient

reviews.text: Location: walking distance to Sol (7 mins)' the Palace (4 mins), Gran Via (10 mins). Lots of good bars,cafes and restaurants close by.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and service, at good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to Madrid with a friend for three days. Stayed at Hotel Opera. The hotel was very modern and clean. Daniel was very pleasant and the hotel staff went out of their way to accomodate my friends birthday by setting up a bottle of sparkling wine in our room the first day of our visit. I had no problem with the internet, it worked fine. Centrally located close to Plaza de Sol and metro station. We rode the tourist sightseeing bus for 21E. It was ok, but nothing special. A lot of beautiful buildings and you can jump on and off from 10 - 6 while the bus runs. You also get ear phones in the language of your choice. Lovely Tapas bars entwined throughout the blocks of the Plaza. Be sure to order a glass of wine or small beer. You will receive a tapas snack. The more wine or beer you order, the better your snack will be. If you ask for it or order it, you will pay for it. I found the town lovely and quaint.
reviews.title: Not a four star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second stay at the Hotel Opera. The location just can't be beat. It's an easy walk to most central Madrid sights and if you need the metro it's only 100 meters away. That said, there is a downside that others have mentioned, that being street noise. They party late in Madrid. Request a higher floor, close the windows and turn on the air conditioning. The hotel is a 4 star property at a stretch. Our room was was big enough and the bathroom was also roomy. However there are no side chairs and furnishings are spartan. The breakfast was fine, but there absolutely no variety day to day. We were there three nights and breakfast could have used something different. All in all I would stay here again because of the price and location.
reviews.title: It's About The Location

reviews.text: I recently visited Madrid in the last two weeks. This hotel has everything you require. The central location to shops and restaurants is just perfect. One particular concierge, Luis Miguel, was so friendly and helpful. He suggested the best places to go and answered all our questions and was fluent in English. If we did not meet Luis then I do believe we may not have eaten at the best places or fully experienced the beautiful city of Madrid. My friends and I shall definitely revisit Madrid and stay at Hotel Opera.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: This is definately not a 4 star hotel,it's 3 star at the very best.The rooms are very tired and worn and ours was not clean when we got it.A major problem is the noise-there is absolutely no soundproofing at all,you can hear every sound from the street and at night it's incredibly noisy.We were on the fifth floor to begin with but got moved to the seventh because the manager said the street noise would be less,it wasn't and the noise from the room above was terrible!Breakfast was a farce,do not bother with breakfast at all.We had booked breakfast and specified that one of us was coliac,when we got to the breakfast room there were people queing for tables and lots of dirty uncleared tables and no sign of staff.I went to find somebody and asked for the gluten free bread and waited,after half an hour I asked another waitress who was incredibly rude and after 45 mins and no bread we left.There was no service from the staff apart from one girl on reception who was very helpful and pleasant.The best thing about this hotel is the loacation but we would not visit again or recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: very disappointing

reviews.text: We have stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We were given a room that was not ready yet but was resolved immediately by the staff.
reviews.title: very accessible

reviews.text: We booked for triple room, and its very spacious. One double bed and sofa bed and so comfortable, linen are very good quality. The bathroom is huge!
reviews.title: Extremely impressed
